wikipedia_page.main: Alec John Dawson (1872 - 3 February 1951), generally known as A. J. Dawson (pseudonyms Captain Dawson, Major Dawson, Howard Kerr, Nicholas Freydon) was an English author, traveller and novelist.  During World War I he attained the rank of Major, and was awarded the MBE and Croix de Guerre in recognition of his work as a military propagandist.  Dawson published over thirty books, the one best remembered today probably being the animal adventure story Finn the Wolfhound (1908).
